shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
September 9 at 1:03 PM ·

Please see the attached flyer that will be presented to students who are sent home from school (for a Remote Hike). Students presenting signs or symptoms of COVID-19 or that have had a risk of exposure will be sent home to work virtually. Just becuase we send students home does not mean that the student has COVID-19 or that they should stop working in their coursework. We will always encourage the student to work from home until they can return to campus.

post_text: Congratulations to senior Cody Roberts! Cody plans to attend college and continue his career in showing horses. His favorite quote is: “Save a Horse, Ride a Cowboy” - Big & Rich. His favorite memory at school was playing basketball before break. Cody wants to thank Mr. Looney and Mrs. Moon because they helped him through math. He also wants to recognize Mrs. Williams and Mrs. Gearheart for helping him with graduation. Cody appreciates MECHS because he was able to continue with horse shows and miss school without punishment. We are so proud of you Cody!

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
June 18 at 10:07 AM ·

Congratulations to Bowman Site senior Macy Miller! Macy plans to attend Georgia Southern University and major in interior design. Her favorite quote is “I believe every human has an infinite number of heartbeats. I don’t intend to waste any of mine. “ -Neil Armstrong. One of her favorite memories was when the students got to have a paint night in the lunchroom. Macy says, "With everyone who has helped me with my journey from MECHS I don’t think I could ever narrow it down to one person. I am forever grateful for the men and women who helped make me graduating possible. Mrs. Griggs, Mrs. Haynes, and Mrs. Williams have all been top role models in my life. They have gone above and beyond what I ever could have expected. They will always be apart of my heart and I love them all very deeply! Thank you MECHS for everything you have done for me"! #classof2020 #graduation2020 #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #mechsgrad2020 #mechsgrad #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance #highschoolgraduate

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
June 17 at 8:48 AM ·

Congratulations to Bowman Site graduate Kayla Perry! Kayla is looking forward to enjoying the rest of the year as a stay at home mom with her daughter, Ava. Kayla then wants to pursue a career as a PCT. Her favorite quote is, "Your greatest contribution to the kingdom of God might not be something you do, but someone you raise." -Andy Stanley. Kayla would like to thank her two graduation coaches, Mrs. Williams and Mrs. Gearheart for all they did to help her. She would also like to thank the teachers who helped her while she worked at home to reach her goals and were always there to support her. Way to go Kayla! #classof2020 #senior2020 #seniorspotlight #highschool #mechsgrad2020 #mechsgrad #mechsgraduation #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance

May 29 at 9:33 AM ·

Congratulations to Bowman Site senior George Fortson! George plans to continue working with his dad painting houses until he knows 100% what he wants to do. We wish you the best in your future endeavors! #classof2020 #graduation2020 #seniorspotlight #senior2020 #mechsgrad #mechsgrad2020 #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance #highschoolgraduation

post_text: As we near the end of the 2019-2020 school year MECHS would like to celebrate our students with the Bragging Wagon! We will be providing a drive-thru meal at the site on Monday, June 1 at 6:00 pm. Students and families, please remain in your vehicle at all times as you drive by and pick up this celebratory meal. In your bag you will receive a hotdog, little Debbie snack, condiments, and a water bottle.

We will be providing a drive-thru meal at the site on Monday, June 1 at 6:00 pm. Students and families, please remain in your vehicle at all times as you drive by and pick up this celebratory meal. In your bag you will receive a hotdog, little Debbie snack, condiments, and a water bottle.

May 26 at 9:14 AM ·

Congratulations to our senior, Faith Palmer, from the Bowman Site. Faith plans to attend college and become a NICU nurse. She wanted to give a personal thanks to Mr. Looney who, "was a beloved staff member because he always made me laugh and pushed me to work harder." Faith also wanted to thank all of the Bowman staff because they never let her give up and always reminded her that graduating with a high school diploma was important. Way to go Faith! #seniorspotlight #classof2020 #senior2020 #graduation #mechsgrad2020 #mountaineducationcharter #1stchoicefor2ndchance #highschool #highschoolgraduation

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
May 22 at 10:00 AM ·

Congratulations to Bowman Site senior Ca'nyia Bush! Ca'nyia plans to further her education at Albany State University and major in biology (pre-med). Her favorite quote is by Maya Angelou, “You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated.”
She thanks all the staff members at MECHS who always encouraged her and never let her give up. Ca'nyia would like to specifically thank Ms. Moon and Mrs. Hill for always making her laugh even on bad days and for pushing her to do and be her best self. Great job Ca'nyia, we are so proud of you! #classof2020 #graduate #mountaineducationcharter #mechsgrad2020 #1stchoicefor2ndchance #seniorspotlight #graduation #highschool

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
April 17 at 1:38 PM ·

MECHS is working diligently to provide the safest option for a commencement ceremony for the spring of 2020. Graduation was originally scheduled for May 30th; however, due to the current situation with COVID-19 graduation will either be postponed until later this summer or we will host a virtual ceremony. With that being said, Dr. Lovell and everyone at MECHS would prefer to host traditional graduation with virtual being the absolute last resort. We are working with the University of North Georgia for potential new dates and times. Once we have more guidance from Governor Kemp and the Department of Education, we will communicate that to all of you. Please be assured that graduation will be happening whether at a later date or virtually.

shared_text:
Mountain Education Charter High School
March 30 at 5:17 PM ·

If you find yourself feeling isolated, worried about your family, concerned about being alone at home with children for days or weeks, or in need of essential resources like food or funds for utilities and rent, please call 1-800-CHILDREN (244-5373). MECHS counselors are also available to families and students during this time. Let’s navigate this new normal together.

post_text: All Mountain Education Charter High School locations will remain closed until further notice due to the impact of COVID-19 in our communities. Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.
text: All Mountain Education Charter High School locations will remain closed until further notice due to the impact of COVID-19 in our communities. Because national and state information about the coronavirus changes daily, we are unable to make decisions about when school will resume. Online learning will continue Monday through Thursday from 4-9 pm.

post_text:
Elbert County: March 16-20 @ElbertCoSchools will be offering a free "grab and go" meal pick-up service for all students (ages 18 and under) on the campuses of Blackwell Learning Center, @ECPSbullfrogs, @ECES_Eagles, @ECMSRAMS, and @ECCHS_GA. The meal pickups are available from 11 am to 1 pm.

Hart County: Beginning Tuesday, March 17, the Hart County Charter System will provide meals to children ages 18 and under free of charge. Children must be present in order to receive meals. Families may pick up meals, Monday through Friday, at their zoned elementary schools between the hours of 10:00 am and 1:00 pm.

North and South Hart Elementary Schools will distribute meals through their car rider lines. Hartwell Elementary School will utilize the Strickland Funeral Home car rider line entrance. Families should not exit their vehicles.

post_text: Congratulations to A. J. Cain, our recent 2020 graduate. A. J. had a village cheering him on along the way. He is shown with his mentor, caring teachers, a graduation coach, and a group of his supportive friends. We are a family at Bowman MECHS.
text: Congratulations to A. J. Cain, our recent 2020 graduate. A. J. had a village cheering him on along the way. He is shown with his mentor, caring teachers, a graduation coach, and a group of his supportive friends. We are a family at Bowman MECHS.

post_text:
A. J. Cain is an example of someone who set goals for himself, worked diligently to meet those goals, and is now a 2020 graduate of MECHS. Congratulations A. J. Cain. We are so proud of you. Your MECHS family will

post_text: Congratulations to Patrick Heard for completing the requirements to earn his high school diploma. Patrick is a hard working young man. His smile has brightened many lives at our site. Serving on the Student Voice Board at our site, Patrick has been a voice for the students and has made a positive impact on our school. Patrick also represented our site as a senior on a tour of Washington, DC. We are excited to see all of the accomplishments ahead for Patrick.

Patrick also represented our site as a senior on a tour of Washington, DC. We are excited to see all of the accomplishments ahead for Patrick.

post_text: Spirit Week continues at MECHS with “Twin Day”! Our Student Voice Board felt “Spirit Week” was just what we needed at the Bowman Site. Our students are setting new records for our site with monthly course completion goals being met, an increase in proficient students on EOCs, and we have dual-enrolled students. Great things are happening at our site.
text: Spirit Week continues at MECHS with “Twin Day”! Our Student Voice Board felt “Spirit Week” was just what we needed at the Bowman Site. Our students are setting new records for our site with monthly course completion goals being met, an increase in proficient students on EOCs, and we have dual-enrolled students. Great things are happening at our site.

September 13, 2019 at 11:04 AM ·

Yesterday was Day 4 in Washington. The students truly had an amazing time and made new friends along the way. Yesterday included Ford’s Theater and lunch at the Hard Rock Cafe before the flight back home. Thank you to everyone who helped make this trip possible through donations and service. MECHS looks forward to this trip every year.

post_text: We proudly announce our first graduate for the MECHS Class of 2020, Colin Berry. What a wonderful night it was for all. Colin plans to attend Athens Technical College in Monroe, GA and become a CNC Machinist. It is his dream to work at Lead Foot Diesel Performance in Monroe. Congratulations Colin!

Colin plans to attend Athens Technical College in Monroe, GA and become a CNC Machinist. It is his dream to work at Lead Foot Diesel Performance in Monroe. Congratulations Colin!
